sols_html:
On the closed interval \([-1,8]\), the global maximum/minimum can occur at critical points or at the endpoints.

If \(f(x) = x^{2/3}\), then \(f'(x) = \frac{2}{3} x^{-1/3}\) which is never \(0\) but is undefined at \(x=0\). The only critical point on the interval is at \(x=0\).

Now we evaluate \(f\) at the critical point and at the endpoints

\[\begin{aligned} f(0) = 0,\end{aligned}\]

\(f(-1) = (-1)^{2/3} = 1\), and \(f(8) = 8^{2/3} = 4\).

In comparing these we find the global maximum is \(4\) occurring at \(x=8\) and the global minimum is \(0\) occurring at \(x=0\).
